intro: Baphia pilosa, commonly known as the hairy baphia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Caesalpiniaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemes, which are followed by pods containing flat, seed-like structures. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
